trends: There has been one other sighting in Ocotillo
There were no other sightings in Ocotillo on or around January 10th 1987
Summary: Two bright red spheres approached from behind, passed overhead, and disappeared ahead in the distance.
divs: sighting detailssee description posted at... http:\\www.well.com\user\satyr\755\globes.txt regarding the date of occurrence: i may have neglected to change the year on the initial form. it was 1987. also, i made an error in the initial date estimate; january 10th is closer than the 18th. it might have been as early as the 7th or as late as the 14th, but definitely not as late as the 18th. regarding other witnesses. there were a few other cars on the road, so someone else must have seen what i saw. regarding my vision: i later developed cataracts, but at that time my vision was still quite correctable. regarding color vision: i have what is typically considered abnormal color vision, but i can still distinguish all primary and secondary colors. regarding change in general health: i undertook a program of regular exercise and persisted at it for most of 1987. regarding education: my degree is in biology, but required a two semester sequence in chemistry and another two semester sequence in physics. regarding the condition of the sky: it was clear behind me, but cloudy ahead, with an electrical storm in the distance. regarding elevation: at first appearance, the spheres were probably 30 degrees above the horizon from my perspective, and at the time that i lost track of them, probably 15 degrees. in between they passed directly overhead. regarding elevation: it might actually have been slightly more than 500 feet. it's difficult to estimate since i can only guess at how big they were, and therefore how high, based on the size of the typical shrubs on the desert floor they were illuminating. in any case, they were not obscured by clouds until they had proceeded very far ahead of me. regarding distance: at closest approach they were only a few hundred feet overhead. at first siting they might have been two miles behind me, and they were definitely many miles ahead when they disappeared. regarding nature of flight path: they seemed to be moving in a straight line as they passed overhead, and then curved very gradually off to the left after moving some distance ahead. regarding their surface characteristics: they were definitely glowing red (possibly monochromatic red), but there was also a moving mottled appearance to them which may have been a reflection of the desert below. regarding their size: 31-100 feet seems most likely to be correct. they might have been slightly smaller or slightly larger, but not by much in either direction. regarding their initial appearance: it seemed abrupt to me, as though they'd just popped into the sky behind me. i couldn't say whether the red light around me grew gradually or suddenly jumped from nothing to substantial, but as a professional driver in the habit of making use of my mirrors, i think i would have noticed them sooner had they followed the same approach path from much further away.
